value.0: <StartAction>[Before you stands a small framed man with facial features resembling those of a rat. He gives you a sharp grin, exposing a set of small, yellowed teeth.]</Start> Care to peruse my wares, young <lad/lass>?
<StartAction>[The merchant snarls angrily.]</Start> I grow tired of that fool constantly harassing my trade! I need to bring an end to his tampering... and perhaps you can aid me in this matter.

Then I am afraid I shall be forced to deal with you as well... I can't have you running back to Markius with this news, now can I? <StartAction>[In a flash, Shrak has drawn a blade from his jerkin, and lunges towards you.]</Start>

Of course, of course. A little gold from my purse would be well worth the price to ensure my trade with the Bloodhawks goes undisturbed. I'll reward you with eight hundred gold. This price, however, is not negotiable.

The Bloodhawks can ill afford for this Markius Albright to continue investigating their base. I will contact my allies among the slavers, and have them "deal" with Markius once and for all... but I will need your help to do this...
Good. Two of my companions reside in one of the inn rooms at the Ravenclaw Tavern. Take this Markius Albright with you, and seek them out.
You will likely find my slaver companions to be suspicious, so knock upon their door three times, and speak the phrase: "The hawk's blood flows freely."
I shall have informed them of your coming, and they will deal with this Markius Albright properly...
Now, rid me of your presence! Come back when the deed is done, and I shall give you your reward.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> <StartAction>[The merchant looks at you with his small eyes narrowed suspiciously.]</Start> I'm sorry, "friend," but I don't know anything but nothing in that regard...
<StartAction>[Shrak sneers at you, drawing a blade from the folds of his jerkin.]</Start> So, you wish to cross paths with me?! You shall fall by my hand!

<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> <StartAction>[Shrak's eyes grow large as he notices your failed attempt to pick his pocket.]</Start> So, you think you can steal from me, worm?! You shall pay dearly for your mistake...
<StartAction>[Success]</Start> <StartAction>[You manage to obtain a small key from Shrak's pocket without his notice.]</Start>
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Your threats do not frighten me, fool! Now begone from my store!
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> <StartAction>[Shrak glimpses your attempt to take his dagger, and swiftly steps aside. You trip during your maneuver, and Shrak presses his blade to your back.]</Start>
You dare cross me, worm?! <StartAction>[With a sneer, Shrak pulls for a blade from his jerkin, and lunges towards you.]</Start>

<StartAction>[Success]</Start> <StartAction>[With a swift flick of your hand, you grab the dagger from Shrak's belt, and quickly press it to his throat. His eyes widen in shock and fear, and he whimpers softly.]</Start>
<StartAction>[Success]</Start> I... I... Oh, alright! I tell you... just... just put that weapon away!
<StartAction>[Success]</Start> Yes, yes... perhaps I might... <StartAction>[Shrak holds out his palm eagerly.]</Start>
Bah! Begone from my store then! I have no time to bother with rabble like you! <StartAction>[Shrak turns away from you, seemingly tired of this conversation.]</Start>

<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I am sorry, but I do not know what you are talking about, <sir/madam>. I'm afraid I cannot be of assistance to you. Now, I must ask that you leave my store, as I have work to attend to...
<StartAction>[Success]</Start> I suppose I might be able to help you for that price...
<StartAction>[Success]</Start> I suppose you do seem trustworthy enough, so perhaps I may be able to help you after all...
<StartAction>[Success] [Shrak nods his head.]</Start> I suppose I know a few people who might be willing to make a purchase...
Luck would have it that I have some friends in town right now, my good <lad/lass>! They're always on the lookout for good specimens. You'll be well paid if your companion is of hardy stock!

Go to the Ravenclaw Tavern, and visit one of the tavern rooms there. Knock upon the door three times, and one of the men I'm speaking of will answer. When he does, say: "The hawk's blood flows freely." That will let them know you were sent by me.
I'd take you myself, but, as I'm sure you can see, I'm a bit preoccupied with business... Now, if you'll just be on your way...

Let us just say that I have a way of acquiring goods normally not allowed in the Market District. The Sharakhan Empire has quite strict regulations on these sorts of things, but that's never stopped <CUSTOM9999>!
<StartAction>[The merchant gives you a suspicious stare.]</Start> That's none of your affair, <lad/lass>! Now, if you are not here to make a purchase, I would ask that you leave!
Then begone from here! I have little time to chatter away when there is business to be done!

I have quite a selection of items that can be found nowhere else in the Market District. I also might be willing to buy any items you have... unlawfully... acquired, though I will have to take a percentage, of course.
<< Activates "N_TALK_SWITCH" if "N_MODULE_STAGE" is 0. >>
<< This conversation node does nothing but reset the variable "N_TALK_SWITCH" >>
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_PRELUDE" >>
<< This node sets up custom string "9999" to be the name of the conversation owner >>
A man named Markius Albright seems curious about slavers.
I think I'll just kill you now.
Forget it! I want no part in this.
I might... if the price was right.
What do you propose?
Very well, I will aid you.
<StartAction>[Charisma]</Start> I'm journeying south and wish to get rid of a servant.
<StartAction>[Leave the merchant stand quietly.]</Start>
You will die by my hand, filthy slaver!
<StartAction>[Pick Pocket] [Perhaps he's carrying something of use.]</Start>
<StartAction>[Intimidate] [Heft your weapon where Shrak can see it.]</Start>
<StartAction>[Dexterity] [Grab Shrak's dagger and place it at his neck.]</Start>
Tell me everything you know...
<StartAction>[Persuade]</Start> Would 50 gold pieces change your mind?
I've changed my mind. Perhaps I don't need your help after all.
<StartAction>[Hand over the 50 gold pieces.]</Start>
<StartAction>[Persuade]</Start> Perhaps for 20 gold pieces you'd remember?
<StartAction>[Hand over the 20 gold pieces.]</Start>
<StartAction>[Persuade]</Start> There is always a market for good help.
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_PREL_LYEN" >>
What is it you sell here?
You sell illegal goods?
I'm not interested in buying anything.
Let me see what you have.
